s.text: The NYT runs the following correction: "Because of an editing error, an article on Feb. 26 about Manhattanites' reliance on mini-storage referred incorrectly to doves and a rabbit used in the act of Arnie Kolodner, a magician.
The document, says the paper, took 11 years to prepare, and was greeted coolly by Jewish leaders.
While he keeps costumes in mini-storage, the rabbit and doves live in his home.
While he keeps costumes in mini-storage, the rabbit and doves live in his home.
While he keeps costumes in mini-storage, the rabbit and doves live in his home.
While he keeps costumes in mini-storage, the rabbit and doves live in his home.

Yesterday's White House response to Willey was primarily two-fold: a strong denial from President Clinton, and the release of a raft of friendly letters Willey sent to the White House after the date she alleges she was groped by Clinton.
Despite the six-cylinder spin cycle, USAT says that "there was no ignoring the dark mood that settled over the White House" in Willey's wake.
